commands.name: az informatica data-management organization create
commands.syntax:
az informatica data-management organization create --name
                                                   --resource-group
                                                   [--company-details]
                                                   [--informatica-properties]
                                                   [--link-organization]
                                                   [--location]
                                                   [--marketplace-details]
                                                   [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                                   [--tags]
                                                   [--user-details]
examples: az informatica data-management organization create -n demoOrg -g demoResourceGroup --subscription ae37d5a8-dff3-49a3-bfcd-139a4f7db98x -l westUS2

commands.name: az informatica data-management organization delete
commands.syntax:
az informatica data-management organization delete [--ids]
                                                   [--name]
                                                   [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                                   [--resource-group]
                                                   [--subscription]
                                                   [--yes]
examples: az informatica data-management organization delete -n demoOrg -g demoResourceGroup --subscription ae37d5a8-dff3-49a3-bfcd-139a4f7db98x

commands.name: az informatica data-management organization list
commands.summary: List InformaticaOrganizationResource resources by subscription ID.
examples: az informatica data-management organization list --subscription ae37d5a8-dff3-49a3-bfcd-139a4f7db98x

commands.name: az informatica data-management organization show
examples: az informatica data-management organization show -g demoResourceGroup -n demoOrg

commands.name: az informatica data-management organization wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition is met.
